intro: ^? I'm glad I ran into you. Octavia heard a rumor through the grapevine that you're making ensaymadas. She would like to reserve two, please."

s: ^Word travels fast! I still depend on my pastry hookup though!
^Once I've actually learned the secrets of ensaymadas, I'll gladly share!

Chat1: ^Rashad?Smiling "Oh,  man. The grapevine got ahead of itself, or my kid heard what she wanted to..."
^Rashad?Smiling "I bet it was wishful thinking - Cheryl got her to swear off solo baking projects after we spent a week vacuuming... and wiping ... and dusting... up flour."
^Rashad?Smiling "All baking requires a buddy, and I bet Olivia would be thrilled to be your buddy."

s: ^I remember. At least it wasn't honey, right?
^Well, that's a mood. Oh, you know what. I have a question for you.

Chat2: ^Rashad?Smiling "Ohhh I forgot about your jar of honey incident. Poor Mr. Calindas almost took back his offer to let  you into his kitchen!"

s: ^...Changing the subject... I could use your help.
^He nearly did! Speaking of Mr. Calindas, I have a question for you.

Explain1: ^Rashad?Neutral "I'm not matching off against him at trivia again; one humiliation was enough."

s: ^No, no. Does the library offers bilingual classes? Or senior tech classes?

Explain2: ^Rashad?Neutral "Hmm. Tech classes, or classes for seniors, or bilingual tech classes?"
^Rashad?Smiling "Or bilingual tech classes for bilingual seniors?"

s: ^I'm looking for a tech class for seniors taught in Tagalog or Spanish.
^Maybe information about helping bilingual seniors learn to use a tablet?

Suggestion1: ^Rashad_Day 3_Free tech classes can help users interact with government agencies and important businesses_Mrcalindas3-3

Suggestion1.#: notification Rashad_Day 3_Free tech classes can help users interact with government agencies and important businesses_Mrcalindas3-3

Suggestion1: ^Rashad?Smiling "Well, we actually have free tech classes in Spanish and Tagalog. You can sign up at the front desk. They aren't specifically for seniors, though."
^Rashad?Neutral "It's really important for people to get to practice workshop skills, so the classes are small and hands-on."
^Rashad?Smiling "I really want everyone to leave one of our classes feeling like they can do something new."
^Rashad?Neutral "As more government agencies and businesses move towards doing business over the internet, being afraid or ignorant of technology becomes a bigger barrier."
^Rashad?Neutral "Seniors, especially, can struggle with filing taxes, filling out forms. Ya know...the stuff nobody likes doing."

s: ^That's great to know! Is there anything else I should think of?

Suggestion2: ^Rashad_Day 3_Seniors can use technology to stay connected with their families_Mrcalindas3-4

Suggestion2.#: notification Rashad_Day 3_Seniors can use technology to stay connected with their families_Mrcalindas3-4

Suggestion2: ^Rashad?Smiling "The internet can be really overwhelming. I think it's important to focus on the good stuff when urging people to learn tech literacy."
^Rashad?Smiling "The internet gives us opportunities to stay connected that never existed before. For example, my kids video chat with their grandparents or my siblings."
^Rashad?Smling "Not going to lie - it feels like something from one of my movies when I realize my kid is getting math help from three states away."
^Rashad?Smiling "I don't mind not being the long division tutor, really."

s: ^This is great information to keep in mind. Thanks, Rashad.

Goodbye: ^Rashad?Smiling "Happy to help out. Now if you'll excuse me, I'm going to go get a presentation ready for the Board."
^Rashad?Smiling "There's a couple programs for seniors I think we could improve. Be good,
